availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Presley F. Hansbrough (Grant County, Kentucky, merchant and soldier - Capt. 11th Ky. Cav.)

body.p: Grant County, Kentucky, merchant and soldier. Virginia native. Married to Martha Louise Johnson Hansbrough in Claiborne County, Mississippi, on February 1, 1843. Father of Walter Hansbrough, Harriet Hansbrough, Elvissa Hansbrough, Presley F. Hansbrough, Jr., and William Hansbrough. Farmer in Grant County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Grant County in 1850. Merchant in Grant County in 1860. Served in the 11th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as first lieutenant and captain from September 22, 1862, to May 15, 1865.

ab.bibl:
